problem_text:
The spectrum of a finite group is the set of orders of its elements. Let ω be a finite set of positive integers. A group G is said to be ω-critical if the spectrum of G coincides with ω, but the spectrum of every proper section of G is not equal to ω.
a) Does there exist a number n such that for every finite simple group G the number of ω(G)-critical groups is less than n?
b) For every finite simple group G, find all ω(G)-critical groups.
V. D. Mazurov
